hypothesis_content.title: Volatility-Squeeze Breakout Momentum Fade in STRESS
hypothesis_content.statement: During STRESS regimes, a sharp, high-volume breakout from a multi-hour compression (Bollinger Band Width 20-period < 0.5) will experience a momentum fade and partial retracement within 2 hours, as the initial move exhausts panic liquidity.
hypothesis_content.rationale: STRESS regimes are characterized by high volatility and emotional trading. A compression phase represents a temporary equilibrium. The subsequent breakout often triggers stop-losses and panic orders, creating an overextended move. Market makers and sophisticated participants fade this excess, knowing sustained directional moves in pure stress are rare without a fundamental catalyst.
entry_conditions: BTC 1H Bollinger Band Width (20,2) < 0.5 for at least 6 hours
A 1H candle closes outside the bands with volume > 150% of 20-period average
Enter on the first 15-minute candle close that shows momentum deceleration (e.g., a doji or small body after large move)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces 50% of the initial breakout candle's range
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price extends beyond the breakout candle's high/low by an amount equal to 25% of that candle's range

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: In STRESS, >55% of high-volume breakouts from tight compression continue trending in the breakout direction for more than 2 hours without a 50% retracement.
